title: New: Zól Bálint  – Domino
body:
As far as ambient music stretches, it is to be said that minimalist efforts don’t equate to minimal effort but, more to my greatest sadness, it generates a hit n miss situation: sticky and sad.

YET, leaning further across to experimental electronic side of ambient, **Zól Bálint** layers up sounds so buttery beautiful that the aural tactility splinters my s.o.u.l. The improvisation leading all, tracing over the evolving quality of the sounds that are hitting – ur – ears – and cascading around you in generated whirs, trances you into a weightless lucidity suspended throughout the track’s almost moody muster; moody in the sense it’s beyond you rather than it having sadness levels beneath you.

Further fun to add: Zól Bálint has a wonderful, handy-seeming custom acoustic-electronic guitar allowing for in-the-moment sound manipulation centring attentional focus and directing the track through, narrowing its chances of wandering off, instead adding more wistful interest to my e.a.r.s. ahhh.

_Domino_ is the first track from Zól Bálint’s upcoming Lane Splitting EP which I for one am very excited about, please be too.
